page.title: 04EMPLOYMENT
page.content: The farms in the area employ a few people, however arable farming is not labour intensive. Many of the smaller farms are run entirely by the families that own them. The people who run these farms and small enterprises such as a hairdresser; agricultural, construction and maintenance contractors, plumbers, and a motor mechanic are mostly self- employed and often do not employ anyone else. The one agricultural & veterinary supplier does not employ anyone from within the area. Some people work at the poultry processing factory. Others in employment, work outside the area, some travelling daily to towns such as Bury St.Edmunds,Ipswich and Norwich. The unemployment rate is no worse than the average for the region of East Anglia as a whole.
